intro: Morongia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican morongo, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
